The 4 stages of decay for the Atheist position:

Stage 1: "There is no evidence!"
This is a common starter claim for many atheists.  It is meant as an objective statement, but all it does is admit ignorance of the topic being discussed.

Stage 2: "I don't find the evidence convincing!"
At this stage the atheist has now contradicted his first claim and has placed himself in a position where he has to (but can't) justify his decision to disbelieve the evidence.

Stage 3: "You and Muslims and Hindus all say the same things!"
Here the atheist is unwittingly cutting his own feet out from under him.  He is attempting to throw relativity into the mix, but is only increasing the Theist argument of the Divine.

Stage 4: "You're just (insert insult here)!"

The 4 stages of decay for the Atheist position:

Stage 1: "There is no evidence!"

Stage 3: "You and Muslims and Hindus all say the same things!"

from under him. He is attempting to throw relativity into the mix, but is only

"A book in the Bible is invalid unless another source outside of it can attest to it."

This argument is flawed on a few levels.  First it treats biblical text with a different standard that other ancient historical works (many of which have supernatural claims in them as well).  Historians are fine with finding a work that mentions Aristotle even if they don't have another source to corroborate that claim.

Second, this puts atheists into an infinite regressive loop.  If a biblical text requires corroboration from another source, then that other source needs corroboration itself from yet another source.  And then that source must be corroborated with something else.  And so on.

What the above argument is trying to do is discredit the text without actually being able to show how it's wrong.
